TOP 5 MOST CONTRACTED AI-COMPUTE CAPACITY IN DEVELOPMENT

Contracted capacity is becoming the single most predictive metric in the entire AI-compute economy.

1. $IREN ~2.9GW 
2. $CRWV ~2.9GW 
3. $CIFR ~2.6GW 
4. $NBIS~2.5GW 
5. $BITF ~1.9GW

These operators locked in land, power & interconnection long before the rest of the market understood how tight the grid would get so now that AI demand is exploding, they are monetizing the actual bottleneck in this cycle since  power has become the pricing layer of intelligence. 

This is why billions of dollars in contracts from $GOOGL, $MSFT, $META, $AMZN & $ORCL are flowing to the few companies that can deliver energized capacity on time.
$AMZN AWS brought Project Rainier online and it now stands as one of the largest operational AI supercomputers in the world

This is exactly what I have been saying about $PLTR every time the media asks. 

The critics are still anchored to near-term multiples while Palantir‚Äôs model scales with global AI CapEx which will be counted in the trillions over the next decade. 

If this buildout continues (and it will) then Palantir becomes an index on the productivity gains of the entire AI revolution.

One rough week and everyone suddenly thinks the AI trade is broken.

Meanwhile $GOOGL, $MSFT, $META & $AMZN just spent this earnings cycle saying power is the new pricing layer of intelligence.

Anyone saying China has a real competitor to $NVDA shows they don‚Äôt actually understand the AI economy because the U.S. still controls the performance curve. 

China‚Äôs advantage is the speed of its power buildout & in an AI world where energy becomes the ceiling then that is the reason we have to take them seriously in this race.

When CEO Dan Roberts said the company is only using ~2% of its total capacity, it instantly clarified why $IREN is one of my core horses in the AI race.

If that tiny slice of the footprint can already support 23K GPUs then scaling toward full utilization means they can expand compute by an order of magnitude without rebuilding anything. 

That is a completely different challenge than the rest of the sector which has to construct, permit & power entirely new infrastructure just to keep up.

A bullish setup for me is when the 8-day EMA is above the 21-day EMA & the stock is holding both the 50-day & 200-day SMA so both momentum + structure are moving in the same direction.

If the only level a stock is holding is the 200-day SMA then the long-term trend is still intact but the momentum has faded so I treat it as a hold.

When the price breaks below all three levels then that is when I consider the trend bearish because the short-term, intermediate & long-term signals are all pointing the same way.

KEY LEVELS TO WATCH FOR THE FINTWIT FAVORITES

Bullish | $NVDA, $AMD, $EOSE, $OPEN

Hold | $TSLA, $PLTR, $IREN, $CIFR, $NBIS, $ONDS, $OKLO, $RKLB, $ASTS, $IONQ, $HOOD, $SOFI, $TEM

Bearish | $ACHR, $OSCR, $HIMS

5 REASONS WHY $NBIS, $IREN, $CIFR, $WULF & $GLXY ARE GETTING HIT THIS WEEK

1. The $APLD bond blowup broke the dam & exposed the weakest link in the AI-infra chain.
A 10% yield on more than $2B of debt with only $634M of equity is the market telling you the model doesn't work without cheap money. Especially when they're paying $275M a year in interest alone on a ~$300M rev base so once the market sees a structure that fragile, it revalues the entire sector because it shows what happens when debt-funded expansion runs into expensive money.

2. The same dollar of AI demand is effectively being financed twice.
Applied Digital borrows heavily to build data centers while their biggest customers $CRWV is also borrow heavily to rent that same capacity, so one balance sheet is stacked on top of another. When both sides of the relationship are levered then any credit stress on the tenant becomes credit stress on the developer & I think that's exactly what the market reacted to this week.

3. The fragility now sits in the mismatch between power, GPUs & timelines.
These data centers cannot generate returns until they have power, grid interconnection & the GPUs required to fill capacity so any delay pushes rev out while interest costs start immediately so lenders are now beginning to question whether the project will produce cash fast enough to service the debt.

4. Every industrial revolution goes through this exact cleanup cycle.
Railroads expanded faster than financing structures could handle then telecom overbuilt fiber before demand arrived then cloud infra front-loaded capital years before returns materialized & the same pattern is emerging here. Capital intensity outruns return visibility, leverage magnifies every hiccup & weak operators lose access to funding long before the winners do. Markets are simply doing what they always do in a capital-heavy boom so I don't see this as a big deal and very healthy. 

5. The AI Utility trade is not ending but entering its first real maturity test.
The market is demanding proof that these digital power plants can earn their cost of capital & the winners will consolidate the rest. I‚Äôve chosen my horses in this race & will be monitoring the thesis closely as it develops.

$AMZN is near its lowest valuation in more than a decade.

NAD+ as a therapeutic is grossly underrecognized/underused, yet it‚Äôs been known about and clinically administered since at least the late 1950s/early 60‚Äôs.

Public funds should be being aggressively applied to broadly research observed clinical benefits for application across multiple domains (metabolic performance, stroke, migraine, post-concussive syndrome, cardiovascular health, chemical dependency, PTSD, mood/cognition, cellular repair/anti-aging).  

The reality is that because it‚Äôs a perfect natural coenzyme, and can‚Äôt be patented or synthetically improved, full awareness through appropriately funded studies could lead to a multibillion dollar competitive impact on Pharma profits.  The incentive for it to get throttled by various special interests is strong.

Bottom line: I'm convinced health optimization (like NAD+ therapy) yields dividends just like a good investment. 

This journey taught me that health truly is wealth. 

Few understand this.

Reality check: NAD+ isn‚Äôt a magic ‚Äì I still needed diet and exercise. 

But it is a force multiplier. 

I take it via daily injection (nearly 100% absorbed vs pills) to get the full benefit, giving my fat loss and recovery extra edge.

How is NAD+ different from caffeine or B12? 

Caffeine gives a quick spike (and then a crash), and B12 mainly helps if you‚Äôre deficient. 

NAD+ works deeper at the cellular, fueling steady energy production with no roller-coaster lows.

My stamina skyrocketed too. 

NAD+ supercharges your mitochondria (cellular power plants) so they produce energy more efficiently. 

The result? 

Better endurance and less fatigue. 

I noticed I could push through tough workouts longer without hitting a wall.

Importantly, NAD+ boosts insulin sensitivity (helping your body control blood sugar better). 

A 10-week human trial found that an NAD+ precursor (NMN) improved muscle insulin sensitivity by ~25% ‚Äì a big win for metabolic health.

NAD+ also revs up your metabolism. 

It plays a crucial role in whether calories get burned for energy or stored. 

Higher NAD+ levels make cells more efficient at burning fat for fuel, so losing weight felt more like a smooth ride than an uphill battle.

What is NAD+? 

It‚Äôs a molecule in every cell that helps turn food into energy (ATP ‚Äì your body‚Äôs energy currency). 

Think of NAD+ as the spark plug for your body‚Äôs engine ‚Äì without it, your cells can‚Äôt efficiently burn fuel.

I typically workout for 2-hours.

My transformation came from fasting, disciplined training, and yes, a daily NAD+ shot. 

Being data-driven, I researched NAD+ and the science blew me away.

Health is wealth ‚Äì literally. 

Over the past 2 years I dropped 100 lbs and transformed my fitness. 

One secret? 

Daily NAD+ injections. 

Yes, the Few and fucked guy is talking biotech. üßµ
